question: The letter of Philippians is from Paul and ________ (Php. 1:1)
What does Paul call both he and Timothy (Php. 1:1)
To what group of people in Philippi is the letter of Philippians written (Php. 1:1)
choice: All the servants of the Lord
All those redeemed by the precious blood of Jesus
All the brother and sisters in Christ

question: What particular positions in the church is the letter to the Philippians directed (Php. 1:1)
What does Paul greet them from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ (Php. 1:2)
When does Paul thank God (Php. 1:3)
choice: When he remembers God’s deliverance at Philippi
When he remembers the grace given to them

question: Why does Paul always pray with joy (Php. 1:5)
choice: Because of their partnership in the gospel
Because of their proclamation of the good news
Because of Christ’s work in them
Because of the grace with which they had received him

question: Of what is Paul confident (Php. 1:6)
choice: That the testimony of their calling would be heard in all the world
That he who began a good work in them would complete it
That he who died for them would save them until the day of Christ
The God’s grace would never abandon them

question: What will the one who began a good work in them do (Php. 1:6)
choice: Save them in the day of judgment
Reward their faithfulness with all joy
Finish it as he had promised

question: Where does Paul say he has the Philippians (Php. 1:7)
The Philippians share in God’s grace with Paul in all of the following situations EXCEPT (Php. 1:7)
choice: When Paul is confirming the gospel
When Paul is defending the gospel

question: What does Paul say God can testify of (Php. 1:8)
choice: Paul had tried to come to them
How Paul longs for all of them

question: How does Paul long for the Philippians (Php. 1:8)
choice: With a heavy heart in Christ
With joy from our Lord Jesus
With the affection of Christ Jesus
With the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ

question: In what does Paul pray their love may abound more and more (Php. 1:9)
choice: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ
In knowledge and depth of insight
In truth and live in Christ Jesus

question: What does Paul pray may abound more and more (Php. 1:9)
What does Paul pray they may be on the day of Christ (Php. 1:10)
When does Paul want them to be pure and blameless (Php. 1:10)
choice: On the day of the Lord

question: What does Paul pray they may be filled with (Php. 1:11)
Why does Paul want them to be filled with the fruit of righteousness (Php. 1:11)
choice: To show forth Christ’s grace until he comes
To the glory and praise of God
For the joy of the Spirit

question: What does Paul say what has actually happened to him has ultimately turned out to serve for (Php. 1:12)
choice: The praise of the glory of God’s grace

question: To whom does Paul especially note that the gospel has been advanced to because he is in chains for Christ (Php. 1:12)
Why does Paul say he is in chains (Php. 1:12)
Because of Paul’s chains, what do the brothers and sisters dare to do (Php. 1:14)
choice: Follow in the footsteps of Jesus

question: Because of Paul’s chains, what have most of the brothers and sisters become (Php. 1:14)
How do some preach Christ (Php. 1:15)
Those that preach Christ out of love do so out of ________ (Php. 1:15)
What do those who preach Christ out of goodwill know about Paul (Php. 1:16)
choice: That he is put there for the defense of the gospel
That he is not guilty of the charges marshalled against him
That he is faithful in all God’s house
That even in chains he glorifies God every time he remembers them

question: Why do some preach Christ trying to stir up trouble while Paul is in chains (Php. 1:17)
When did some preach Christ out of selfish ambition, hoping to stir up trouble for Paul (Php. 1:17)
choice: When he was forced not to speak

question: How did the brothers and sisters proclaim the gospel while Paul was in chains (Php. 1:14)
What is Paul’s response whether Christ is preached from motives that are true or false (Php. 1:18)
Paul acknowledges that through what will it turn out for his deliverance (Php. 1:19)
Paul acknowledges that through what will it turn out for his deliverance (Php. 1:19)
choice: Through the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ

question: How does Paul see God’s provision which will lead to his deliverance (Php. 1:19)
What does Paul hope and eagerly expect that he will not do (Php. 1:20)
choice: Become bitter because of his chains

question: What does Paul hope that he will have (Php. 1:20)
What does Paul hope will happen whether by life or by death (Php. 1:20)
choice: That the gospel may be proclaimed
Christ will be exalted in his body
The God will receive all the glory

question: Having said that for Paul to live is Christ, how does he see his own death (Php. 1:21)
For Paul what does it mean to go on living (Php. 1:22)
What does Paul desire (Php. 1:23)
choice: To depart and be with Christ

question: What does Paul see as more necessary for them (Php. 1:23f)
choice: That he be faithful to the end
That he remain in his body
That he come to them shortly

question: What does Paul say is far better (Php. 1:23)
choice: To pray for the saints in the Lord
To depart and be with Christ

question: For what will Paul remain and continue for the Philippians (Php. 1:25)
choice: For their instruction and guidance in the Spirit
For their advancement in the gospel
For their progress and joy in the faith

question: What does Paul hope the Philippians will get to do on account of his being with them again (Php. 1:26)
What does Paul tell the Philippians to do, whatever happens (Php. 1:27)
choice: Conduct themselves in a worthy manner
Give thanks to the Lord always
Rejoice and be glad in the salvation they have in Christ

question: What does Paul want them to strive together as one for (Php. 1:27)
choice: The salvation which is in Christ Jesus

question: What does Paul desire to know whether he comes to see them or not (Php. 1:27)
choice: That they are strong in their faith
That they stand firm in one Spirit
That they seek the kingdom of Christ

question: What does Paul tell the Philippians they should not be as a result of those who oppose them (Php. 1:28)
What will the fact that the Philippians are not frightened will be a sign to those who oppose them (Php. 1:28)
choice: That they are impotent against the cross of Christ
That the Philippians have the peace of God
That they will be destroyed and the Philippians saved
That the Philippians have a strong and fearless faith

question: What has been granted to the Philippians who believe in Christ (Php. 1:29)
choice: To seek the kingdom of Christ
To suffer for him as well

question: What did both Paul and Philippians share in common (Php. 1:30)
Paul says if they have any encouragement from __________ (Php. 2:1)
Paul says if they have any comfort from __________ (Php. 2:1)
In what did Paul ask if they had any common sharing (Php. 2:1)
How did Paul say they could make his joy complete (Php. 2:2)
Paul desires that they have the same love and share in one spirit and one _______ (Php. 2:2)
What does Paul say they should not do anything out of (Php. 2:3)
What does Paul say they should not do anything out of (Php. 2:3)
What does Paul say they should do in humility (Php. 2:4)
choice: Pray to the Father of lights

question: What does Paul say they should not look to (Php. 2:4)
choice: The lust of the eyes and desires of the flesh

question: What does Paul say they should have in their relationships with one another (Php. 2:5)
choice: Love for one another in reverence to Christ
The same mindset as Christ Jesus

question: What did Christ not consider as something to be used for his own advantage (Php. 2:6)
choice: His position as king of all

question: What nature did Christ take upon himself (Php. 2:7)
choice: The nature of a human being

question: What did Christ do when he found himself in the appearance of a man (Php. 2:8)
choice: He gave himself as a sacrifice
He served his Father in heaven

question: How did Christ humble himself (Php. 2:8)
choice: By offering himself as a sacrifice
By giving his life as a ransom for many
By seeking the will of the Father

question: What did God do in response to Christ humbling himself becoming obedient to death (Php. 2:9)
choice: He lifted him up from the dead
He exalted him to the highest place
He pardoned the sins of humankind

question: What did God do in response to Christ humbling himself becoming obedient to death (Php. 2:9)
choice: He lifted him up from the dead
He pardoned the sins of humankind
He gave him a name above every name

question: What did will happen at the name of Jesus (Php. 2:10)
choice: The church will stand in honor
All will look to him as the savior of the world
The kingdom will be given to him

question: At the name of Jesus every knee will bow in all of the following places EXCEPT (Php. 2:10)
What will every tongue do (Php. 2:11)
choice: Be silent before the throne of God
Acknowledge that Jesus Christ is Lord
Sing praise to the Lamb of God
Confess that Jesus was the son of God

question: To what end will every tongue acknowledge that Jesus Christ is Lord (Php. 2:11)
choice: So the ends of the earth may know
To exalt in the truth of God’s salvation
To the glory of God the Father
To the unify the church of God

question: What had the Philippians always done (Php. 2:12)
What does Paul tell the Philippians to do with fear and trembling (Php. 2:12)
choice: Suffer for the sake of Christ

question: How does Paul tell them to work out their salvation (Php. 2:12)
To what end does God work in them (Php. 2:13)
choice: To deliver them from the evil one
To bond them into one body
To produce in them the fruit of the Spirit

question: Paul tells the Philippians, without what are they to do everything (Php. 2:14)
Paul tells them to become what type of children of God (Php. 2:15)
In what type of generation are the Philippians to be blameless and pure children of God (Php. 2:15)
choice: A generation full of strife and envy

question: To what does Paul liken the Philippians who are blameless and pure in a crooked generation (Php. 2:15)
To what does Paul tell them to hold firmly (Php. 2:16)
Why does Paul want them to hold firmly to the word of life (Php. 2:16)
choice: So that he can boast on the day of Christ
So that he may give glory to God on their behalf
So that they may receive an incorruptible inheritance
So that all may know of the gospel of Christ

question: If they hold firmly to the word of life then what will be true for Paul (Php. 2:16)
choice: He will praise God for them
He will not have run in vain
He will have the proof of his calling

question: Even when will Paul be glad and rejoice with all of the Philippians (Php. 2:17)
choice: If Timothy comes and visits him bring news of their faith
If he comes and sees them after he is released from his chains
If he is poured out like a drink offering on the sacrifice
If he must shed his blood on their behalf

question: What should the Philippians be with Paul (Php. 2:18)
Who did Paul hope to send to the Philippians (Php. 2:19)
What would make Paul happy (Php. 2:19)
choice: When they were established in Christ
When he heard news about them
When they received Timothy with joy

question: Why was there no one like Timothy for Paul to send to them (Php. 2:20)
choice: He understood the mystery of God in Christ Jesus
He had cared deeply for the needs of Paul
He had genuine concern for their welfare
He was a faithful servant of Christ

question: Paul comments, for what does everyone look out for (Php. 2:21)
What had Timothy done that Paul recommends him to the Philippians (Php. 2:22)
choice: He had learned the Scripture from his youth
He served with Paul in the work of the gospel
He has suffered much on their behalf

question: Paul refers to Timothy as a ________ (Php. 2:22)
When does Paul hope to send Timothy to the Philippians (Php. 2:23)
choice: As soon as he finds out how things go for him
As soon as Timothy is ready
As soon as the church at Rome bids him go
As soon as the time for traveling on the sea had come

question: Of what was Paul confident in the Lord (Php. 2:24)
choice: That the time of his salvation was drawing near
That he himself would come to them soon
That Timothy would bring them joy in the Lord
That someday they would all be together again

question: Who does Paul call his co-worker (Php. 2:25)
Epaphroditus is listed as all of the following in relation to Paul EXCEP (Php. 2:25)
Why had the Philippians sent Epaphroditus to Paul (Php. 2:25)
Why was Epaphroditus distressed (Php. 2:26)
choice: Because the Philippians heard he was ill
Because he had suffered for the name of Christ
Because he could not be with the Philippians

question: What did God do for Epaphroditus (Php. 2:26)
choice: Delivered him from the mouth of lions
Brought him safely to greet Paul

question: Who was ill and almost died (Php. 2:26)
How does Paul describe his grief if anything happened to Epaphroditus (Php. 2:27)
When Paul sends Epaphroditus to the Philippians, what benefit will that be to Paul (Php. 2:28)
choice: He will find out how they are

question: How did Paul encourage the Philippians to welcome Epaphroditus (Php. 2:29)
What did Epaphroditus do to make up for the help they could not give Paul (Php. 2:30)
choice: He carried his cross to Rome
He suffered at the hands of wild beasts

question: What should the Philippians do for people like Epaphroditus (Php. 2:29)
What is no trouble for Paul (Php. 3:1)
choice: To write the same things to them
To tell them of his sufferings

question: Paul tells the Philippians to ________ in the Lord (Php. 3:1)
Paul tells the Philippians to watch for all of the following EXCEPT (Php. 3:2)
How does Paul say, we who are of the circumcision serve God (Php. 3:3)
choice: By the washing of the word

question: In what does Paul say, we boast (Php. 3:3)
In what does Paul say he has more reasons to have confidence in (Php. 3:3)
In terms of the flesh, what does Paul have good reasons for (Php. 3:4)
On what day was Paul circumcised according to the law (Php. 3:5)
Of what tribe of Israel was Paul (Php. 3:5)
What was Paul in regard to the law (Php. 3:5)
When Paul was boasting about his confidence in the flesh what did he list as proving his zeal (Php. 3:6)
choice: He opposed the Romans in the temple area
He went three times to Jerusalem

question: In what did Paul consider himself formerly faultless based on the law (Php. 3:6)
What does Paul consider all the things that used to be gain for him (Php. 3:7)
What does Paul consider all the things that used to be gain for him (Php. 3:7)
For Christ Jesus, what has Paul done (Php. 3:8)
choice: Suffered at the hands of many

question: Why does Paul consider the things he has lost garbage (Php. 3:8)
choice: So that God may be glorified
So that they might rejoice with him
So that he may gain Christ
So that they may be built up in Christ

question: In Christ, what does Paul not have (Php. 3:9)
On what basis does Paul have the righteousness of God (Php. 3:9)
choice: On the fruit of the Spirit

question: What does Paul want to do (Php. 3:10)
choice: To glorify God in his flesh

question: What does Paul want to know (Php. 3:10)
choice: The calling and election of God
The full measure of the grace of God

question: Paul wants to be like Christ in _______ (Php. 3:10)
In what does Paul want to participate (Php. 3:10)
To what does Paul want to attain (Php. 3:11)
choice: The righteous that is through faith

question: What has Paul not already done (Php. 3:12)
choice: Come to the fullness of faith

question: For what does Paul press on to take hold of (Php. 3:12)
choice: That for which Christ had taken hold of him
His calling by which he was called to be an apostle of Christ
The needs of the community of Christ

question: What one thing does Paul do (Php. 3:13)
choice: Forgiving those who had hurt him

question: What one thing does Paul do (Php. 3:13)
choice: Looking to the author and finisher of his faith
Pursuing the grace of God for the glory of Christ
Leaning in to the kingdom of Christ

question: For which prize does Paul press on to win (Php. 3:14)
choice: The one which led to the building up of the Philippians
The release from his chains which he desired
The one which will result in receiving a crown from Christ
The one which God had called him heavenward in Christ

question: To what does Paul say we should live up (Php. 3:15)
choice: The love which is in Christ Jesus
To what we have already attained
To the goal of unity in Christ Jesus

question: On whom does Paul say they should keep their eyes on (Php. 3:17)
choice: Those who live as Paul does
Those who are sacrificing their lives for Christ
Those who love as Christ did

question: Who did Paul say they had as an example (Php. 3:17)
How do many live (Php. 3:18)
choice: Walking in the ways of wickedness

question: What is the destiny of the enemies of the cross of Christ (Php. 3:19)
What is the god of the enemies of the cross of Christ (Php. 3:19)
What is the glory of the enemies of the cross of Christ (Php. 3:19)
One what is mind of the enemies of the cross of Christ set on (Php. 3:19)
For what does Paul eagerly await (Php. 3:20)
choice: The coming of the Savior from heaven
The coming of the kingdom of Christ
The revelation of the children of God

question: Our _________ is in heaven (Php. 3:20)
How will our bodies be transformed (Php. 3:21)
Our bodies will be transformed by what power in Christ (Php. 3:21)
choice: That raised him from the dead after covering our sins
That made him ascend to the Father’s right hand
That cleanse us from the grasp of sin and death
That enables him to bring everything under his control

question: What does Paul encourage them as his joy and crown to do (Php. 4:1)
What does Paul plead with Euodia and Syntyche to be (Php. 4:2)
Who does Paul plead that they be of the same mind (Php. 4:2)
What did Euodia and Syntyche contend at the side Paul (Php. 4:3)
choice: The truth of the grace of God

question: Who does Paul mention as having contended in the cause of the gospel along with Syntyche and Euodia (Php. 4:4)
What did Paul say about the names of his co-workers (Php. 4:3)
choice: They are in the book of life
They are in the list that he sent

question: What does Paul tell the Philippians to do always and then he says it again (Php. 4:4)
What does Paul tell them should be evident to all (Php. 4:5)
What does Paul say they should not be about anything (Php. 4:6)
How should their prayers and petitions be presented to God (Php. 4:6)
Paul tells them in every situation what should they do (Php. 4:6)
What does Paul say should be presented to God (Php. 4:6)
What transcends understanding (Php. 4:7)
What will the peace of God do (Php. 4:7)
choice: Write their names in the book of life

question: Paul lists all of the following as things that they should think about EXCEPT (Php. 4:8)
What does Paul tell them to do with what they had learned, received and heard from him (Php. 4:9)
If they put into practice what they had learned from Paul, what would be with them (Php. 4:9)
Over what did Paul rejoice (Php. 4:10)
What did the Philippians not have (Php. 4:10)
choice: An opportunity to show their concern

question: What has Paul learned in whatever circumstance he finds himself (Php. 4:11)
Paul said he knows how to be content both in ________ and _____ (Php. 4:12)
Through what can Paul do all things (Php. 4:13)
choice: Through the cross of the Lord Jesus Christ
Through the power of the resurrection
Through him who gives him strength
Through the power of the Spirit

question: What was good for the Philippians (Php. 4:14)
choice: To petition with prayer and fasting

question: What did only the Philippians churches do (Php. 4:15)
choice: Shared with Paul in the matter of giving
Sent aid to Paul while he was in chains
Wept for him because of his imprisonment
Gave him a place to rest his head

question: The Philippians church is located in what region (Php. 4:15)
What does Paul desire for the Philippians (Php. 4:17)
choice: That God return to them the way they had blessed Paul
That all the churches might follow their example
That their aid be credited to their account
That their generosity be known throughout the world

question: Where had the Philippians initially sent aid to Paul (Php. 4:16)
From whom did Paul receive their gifts (Php. 4:18)
What did Paul call the gifts the Philippians had send to him by the hand of Epaphroditus (Ph. 4:18)
choice: A fragrant offering pleasing to God
A peace offering filling up the sufferings of Christ

question: According to what will God meet all their needs (Php. 4:19)
choice: According to his riches in heaven
According to their desires in Christ
According to the riches of his glory
According to the riches of his grace

question: What will God meet according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus (Php. 4:19)
choice: All their sacrifices on Paul’s behalf

question: Who did Paul say were sending greetings to the Philippians (Php. 4:21)
choice: The other prisoners who shared Paul’s chains
The brothers and sisters who were with him
All those of the household of Herod

question: Who did Paul say they should greet from him at Philippi (Php. 4:21)
choice: All those called in Christ Jesus

question: Who did Paul say especially sent their greetings (Php. 4:22)
What did Paul say should be with their spirit (Php. 4:23)
choice: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ
